private_information: I am agent_1 and I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E.
I can only move a disk if it is the top disk on its peg and I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to transform the initial Tower of Hanoi configuration into the target configuration by moving only disks A, B, C, D, E when appropriate.

private_information: I am agent_2 and I am allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J.
I can only move a disk if it is the top disk on its peg and I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to transform the initial Tower of Hanoi configuration into the target configuration by moving only disks F, G, H, I, J when appropriate.

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and must integrate their proposed move sequences into a correct global plan.
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that represents the final planned solution and the multi-agent constraints.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a valid PDDL domain and problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance and the cooperative multi-agent plan, and integrate the agents' primitive move lists into the final plan.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labelled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle and right pegs empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top to bottom A, B, C; right peg empty.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move one top disk at a time, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Agents have disk-specific movement permissions: agent_1 can move A-E, agent_2 can move F-J.
Moves must be represented as primitive moves of the form 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform when asked. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk of a peg and do not place a larger disk on a smaller one. Format each primitive move exactly as agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with initial and goal configurations as provided in the environment public information. Your private information: you may move disks A, B, C, D, E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks you are allowed to move. Do not output PDDL. If you cannot move because a disk you are allowed to move is not on top, indicate no move for that step. The output must be a plain ordered list where each line is of the form 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You are allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform when asked. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk of a peg and do not place a larger disk on a smaller one. Format each primitive move exactly as agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with initial and goal configurations as provided in the environment public information. Your private information: you may move disks F, G, H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks you are allowed to move. Do not output PDDL. If you cannot move because a disk you are allowed to move is not on top, indicate no move for that step. The output must be a plain ordered list where each line is of the form 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your role is to integrate the primitive move lists provided by the two agents into a coherent combined plan and to produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must encode the 3 pegs, the 10 disks A-J, the Tower of Hanoi legality constraints, and separate action schemas or action annotations that keep the agents' moves distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards by using standard STRIPS-compatible constructs and avoid advanced nonstandard features.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive two ordered lists of primitive moves named moves_agent_1 and moves_agent_2. Integrate these lists into a single valid sequence that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent movement permissions. Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that encode the instance and the integrated plan. Keep the actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the PDDL representation. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
